0.definition: Needless motivation for one's country or organization, as a result of bombastic self-pride
0.example: Santhosh is a jingoistic man that believes that he's going to hit diamond in a week

1.definition: A state of series of misfortune that heavily impact's one circumstance
1.example: Sometimes, we become despondent after looking at placements, just to turn around and queue up for another valo comp

2.definition: An exciting and joyful moment that usually sprout a great deal of fun
2.example: Speaking with strangers is exhilarating sometimes since you realise that this is the person you've always been looking for, like look at those fresh organs

3.definition: It is a way of describing something in a exaggerated manner often in a ludicrous way
3.example: Detective, this is disturbing, the suspect drew a caricature with the blood of the victim, how demonic

4.definition: The state of being extremely optimistic; fully buoyant
4.example: Listen, it doesn't hurt to think a little negatively from time to time, being all roseate and believing in god while a person is being stabbed to death isn't a very great idea in my opinion

5.definition: Needless pride or conceit for self-damnation
5.example: In the olden days, kings wished to die in hubris in a way against their kingdom, however most died sitting in their own throne poisoned by the minister, this case doesn't seem like a replica of the sort

6.example: I did have a premonition about the murder taking place on the 61st street but I would've never guessed that it was actually going to happen

7.example: Some of the people I know are extremely petulant and never back down in an argument, I have little praise for their method of debate though

8.example: This murder does have quite a few recondite elements, how did the murderer even get into the house at all?

9.example: The owner was one that was sedulous in her work, keeping track of accounts and business deals in well planned out ledgers

10.definition: Losing an opportunity because they don't have confidence in their ability
10.example: Why did the murderer not take down anyone else in the family? Was he just diffident on getting the entire job done? I suppose not

11.definition: When a condition is further worsened by negligible governance
11.example: The escape route was very well planned out too, the owners really did exacerbate their situation by not cleaning up the backyard

12.example: Did you hear what the detective said? It really does seem like he's a stolid man considering that he didn't rise to the bait of the murderer and took a squad with him

13.definition: Harmless and naturally good for health
13.example: Detective, did you really believe that I'd be an innocuous man? Of course I wouldn't be surrendering myself to you, that makes no sense!

14.definition: A state of partial development which is insufficient
14.example: The preparation for my future is inchoate, and practically useless, there's not much else to say

15.definition: Sudden, impulsive and behaving in a crazy way
15.example: The actions that man took for his family's safety was capricious, but luckily no one was harmed

16.definition: To treat someone like a celebrity
16.example: One really wonders whether influencers need to be lionized all that much considering the sub standard effort they put into their content

17.example: No, I will not gainsay any of these people, their worries are valid and need to be heard!

18.example: The changes that the company is making towards their increasing demand is conspicuous to say the least

19.definition: Something that stays for a short duration
19.example: Don't worry about it, being shamed in class is definitely going to be an ephemeral experience for our child, he's definitely not going to be traumatized

20.example: Are you for real? Why did you whip out your cock in the middle of the show, the ramifications for this are going to be intense

21.definition: A prolonged resentment over a thing usually seen as a complaint
21.example: Are you still passing jeremiads on the ice cream truck guy? He only molested you once!

22.example: Listen, I'm not decadent, I'm just really close to Diamond 1 in the game, queue up again, Jim!

23.definition: Tending to cause fire, or very intense
23.example: The conversation became an incendiary debate on who deserves the prize

24.definition: To recall an order, or revoke a license
24.example: Wait, you're actually going to countermand me because I shot that black man? That's absurd!

25.example: Yup, they can't stop me, me breaking out of jail is inexorable

26.example: Despite breaking out of jail, Harlot spent a good year in penury before he got rid of his diffidence and picked up a store job

27.example: Volubility is well received in today's world, stammering and overspeaking is viewed in disgrace though

28.definition: Anything is firmly estalished, unlikely to change
28.example: Huh, I always figured that the government would be entrenched and nothing would change, perhaps now's the time for change

29.definition: Process of aging and becoming greyish white
29.example: That hoary man wished to prey on little children, good that the volubile judge didn't let him go that easily

30.example: The craven student was diffident about his inchoate progress to give a speech on it

31.example: The ones that become generals in the army are intrepid ones, ones that can face a gun to their temple and not bat an eye

32.example: Listening to Joji is a lugubrious experience but I don't think I'd trade it for anything else

33.example: The officer was vivacious for some odd reason, his task was only paperwork

34.definition: Act of destroying at the root
34.example: Some believe that killing baby hilter would have extirpated the world war

35.definition: Having a minor weakness in one's character
35.example: If there's something that makes Arthur foible, it would have to be his family

36.example: Due to covid, the economy was protean as all hell, no one knew what was to happen

37.example: I lead life in a slattern fashion

38.example: After listening to a talk about alcohol, Fathima was nonplussed about a lot of things, starting with, how did she even end up here?

39.example: The shots that some pros hit are diabolical, that aim is insane!

40.definition: Being commonplace; having no original value
40.example: A lot of the people that feel like they're a part of the cool kids club are generally as trite as one can get, with nothing defining them as one of a kind

41.definition: Uneasiness caused by guilt or remorse
41.example: Sometimes these people also writhe in compunction since they lie to those around them about how exciting their day has been

42.definition: A leader or government with illimitable power they can exercise to any extent
42.example: While these trite humans believe that they are despotic, it is ironical that they hold little power in influencing those around them significantly

43.definition: Saying no to food or alcohol; restraining indulgence
43.example: While most ordinary humans would have some form of restraint, these abstemious reprobates care too little about their cash and give in to their desires without hesitation

44.example: A tumultuous group generally brings school bullies down to their knees

45.example: A lot of spendthrifts turn listless when they look at their bank statement, I wonder if they've ever considered a parsimonous lifestyle

46.example: While the bible talks about the evils of Rome against their god, the debauchery of priests who molest children is overlooked

47.definition: Quality of being flat, dull, monotonous and boring
47.example: Priests are generally platitude until you start talking about children

48.definition: Forerunner; one that initiates a major change
48.example: I'm waiting for the harbringer of child protective services, these priests are starting to get out of hand

49.example: The last I remember, Haikyuu went on hiatus and returned back six years later with garbage animation quality

50.definition: Something is done without a forethought; haste; rash
50.example: That impetuous priest let the child go without telling him to stay silent and now our church is under fire!

51.definition: Showing lively or enthusiastic expression of thoughts
51.example: Why does that priest look ebullient all of sudden? Wait, why is that child crying?

52.example: The highfalutin girls at college wear exotic dresses, that would be cool normally but most of them look like whores

53.example: The priest said that he was expressing his beautitude to the child in that room, somehow that seems fishy

54.example: A new gaming laptop generally has me beholden to my parents, there's not much else I desire in life

55.example: One fine clandestine evening, Shishimaru snuck cocaine into Ninja Hattori's food

56.definition: Experienced or realized through sympathetic participation
56.example: Some people say that watching others skydive is a vicarious thrill when you're afraid of heights, but I could say the same for netorare

57.example: Vietnamese veterans generally have an indelible experience of the war, for example, a disco light caused my grandfather to have a stroke

58.example: Mental fortitude is hard to come by in people with a pornographic addiction

59.example: The businessman showed Ashley a medley of pleasure instruments

60.definition: Marked with tranquility, contentment and happiness
60.example: Japanese backyards present you with a halcyon setting for relaxation

61.definition: Act of going against one's oath
61.example: Perjury is trite in No Nut November challenges, most people don't have the fortitude for it

62.definition: State of disuse and being rundown
62.example: Once a fire broke out and killed 20 people in the building, no one has rented out a flat in the building, look at the desuetude

63.definition: State of tolerant and being self-restrained
63.example: No nut november is all about forbearance and fortitude

64.example: Being a treacherous man in the army sounds like a good way to die on the battlefield

65.example: I know far too many people that are fractious, it's a breath of fresh air to meet someone that doesn't take offense to my words

66.definition: Having no match to another; distinct
66.example: The Wandering Inn is a peerless novel, yet it is a pity that it is not well known

67.definition: To express a strong disapproval of something
67.example: Listen officer, I objurgate child trafficking too, why are you arresting me?

68.definition: To happen again or breat out
68.example: Even after the murderer is caught, people are afraid of it recrudescing

69.definition: Having a cruel disregard or dismay to arts or artistic things
69.example: Showing that philistine man your artwork was the one way to ruin your cherubic day and you managed to do it

70.definition: A fault due to weakness of moral character
70.example: Netorare is a genre that is filled with the frailty of the spouse

71.definition: Blunt in manner or speech; being abrupt or rude
71.example: Most call me a brusque man, but I really just don't like beating around the bush

72.example: Once you piss off an intractable man, it's hard to stop his harangue

73.example: A tenacious mind allows one to solve even the most ridiculous of puzzles

74.example: The ones who shine during a debate are those that are succinct in their responses

75.example: Greeting guests in a perfunctory task, and if I could, I'd do away with it in a heartbeat

76.example: Browsing through instagram is an inveterate habit that I would like to get rid of

77.definition: A source of help in a difficult situation
77.example: After ordering far too much for the dine-in, Jack's only recourse to not waste food was to pack it up for a takeaway

78.definition: The act of betraying someone or something
78.example: Once I dashed into site, the team's perfidy deeply wounded me as they did not rush into site

79.definition: A wasting away or progressive decline; reduction in quality
79.example: The tempetuous winds caused the freshly painted houses to fall into atrophy

80.definition: Intended for display; open for view
80.example: Window shopping isn't allowed? I thought it was an ostensible shop

81.example: Once the catacombs had fallen, the mysterious of the city's haunted sewer system were unearthed

82.example: The judge has made their irrevocable decision, there is no use pleading now

83.definition: Feeling or showing sorrow and remorse for a sin
83.example: Most people who confess in church are contrite with the sins they have committed

84.example: That guy was as inept as one can get with his mediocre magic tricks

85.example: This passage pertains to the Book of the Kamasutra!

86.definition: The act or process of atonement
86.example: One goes from being contrite to expiating for the sins they have committed

87.example: He rebuffed me despite providing perfectly reasonable logic

88.example: Despite expressing my fidelity, the group's perfidy took me to tears

110.definition: stubbornly refusing to change one's opinion
110.example: Sometimes, I really wonder whether I'm wasting my time arguing about the better sex with some obdurate fools

111.definition: seeking to promote the welfare of others
111.example: A lot of millionaires are philanthropic, they say it's because they care about the world, but I'm pretty sure it's just to cover up the fact that they don't know what to do with it

112.definition: to go back and forth between choices

118.definition: avoid telling the truth by not directly answering a question

119.example: The yoke of religion unites quite a few, but somehow it just seems like the formation of a cult to me
